tweets.text:
Challenge! Going for my 2nd @WildTroutTrust #TroutInTheTown proficiency badge with this beauty... All 1.2km of it

Out with @BradfordsBecks @bradfordmdc @EnvAgencyYNE & @EAGeomorphology https://t.co/ocDZZoVnZl

@greenarteries @TerryMac999 @markrwilliamson @dottymcl @BBCCambs @CambsCC @wre @GreaterCambs Here's the @EnvAgency data that I used for last night's presentation. 

First the River Cam, current overall environmental health 'Poor' Reasons for not reaching 'Good' status attached. (1/3) https://t.co/uTMSWl0Cxq

"IMAGINE...the panic you feel when you realise that your home is being inundated by the water. What to do first? Phone your partner who is working away from home, or try and save as many of your possessions as you can? You are numb with the shock. "

tweets.text: @samstebbings18 @DiGeremias @_RobbieMoore @AireIncinerator @EnvAgency @IlkleyChat I‚Äôm not, as I‚Äôve previously being critical of the Labour led council. But on this issue, whilst they have abs are of the accountability the planning laws and environmental standards for under the Conservative government‚Äôs remit making them equally accountable.
Continuation of weed cutting on the River Eau by @GroundControlGC for the @EnvAgencyMids making good progress, flow already better to help flood prevention. https://t.co/Dq2ZQNTB1r

@bilgribs @Blacky_Himself @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Yes totally, our rivers are in a mess and feels the should be protectors don't actually give a hoot. 
I'm in East anglia and have seen a massive decline over the years. The river waveny and wensum in particular

@Feargal_Sharkey @greenarteries @TerryMac999 @markrwilliamson @dottymcl @BBCCambs @CambsCC @wre @GreaterCambs @EnvAgency I wonder if the definition of good, moderate and poor has shifted over the years too. Another way of potentially making things look better than they are...

@greenarteries @TerryMac999 @markrwilliamson @dottymcl @BBCCambs @CambsCC @wre @GreaterCambs @EnvAgency Lastly River Rhee, current overall environmental health 'Moderate'. Reasons for not reaching 'Good' status attached, in short, sewage. Details of the Haslingfield sewage overflow attached. Discharged for a total 1009 hours in 2019 the equivalent of 1 day per week for 42 weeks. https://t.co/RouzEpLZgs

@greenarteries @TerryMac999 @markrwilliamson @dottymcl @BBCCambs @CambsCC @wre @GreaterCambs @EnvAgency Secondly the River Granta, current overall environmental health "Moderate" Reasons for not reaching 'Good' status attached. (2/3)

Obviously I'm curious how you can grade a river as 'Moderate' in 2019 when there was actually little if any water in? https://t.co/MQPjAcAUm6

tweets.text: Today at @gloss environment meeting I raised massive issue of untreated sewage being spilled regularly in Bourton and Fairford. The @EnvAgency were surprised how high the spillage rates were. We need concrete action on this #pollution #rivers #Cotswolds https://t.co/Eqkk1nPvJU

@paulcotswolds @gloss @EnvAgency Well done Paul, fantastic job. 

FYI the @CommonsEAC announced an inquiry into water quality & sewage yesterday. Worth putting a submission together?

As you probably remember the committee chairman's  Sewage Bill has a 2nd reading in Jan. @Dunne4Ludlow

https://t.co/aJxRYSXNP7

tweets.text: @smitd28 @DiGeremias @_RobbieMoore @AireIncinerator @EnvAgency @IlkleyChat My point exactly your just defending them every time. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

@Nickhod53168394 @Blacky_Himself @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency It is totally bewildering. I have been talking to experts over the last few days ... and they say mass fish kills are usually associated with significant pollution events. If the EA does not attend then it is very unlikely that the polluters will be prosecuted or held to account.

@samstebbings18 @DiGeremias @_RobbieMoore @AireIncinerator @EnvAgency @IlkleyChat You seem to be in the same boat Sam, more bothered about attacking Labour than looking at how this could have been stopped and actually holding to account those who‚Äôs action / inaction has led us to the situation we‚Äôre in.

@RibbleValleyBC pimlico stream pollution from building site Chatburn Road, Clitheroe. rang Rvbc env agency who stated ‚Äúnot their remit‚Äù. yet surely if permission has been given to build then the site has to abide by some kind of conditions? fish have moved on.  no birds washing. https://t.co/asvV7cIN54

tweets.text: @bilgribs @Blacky_Himself @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Shocking that

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

@Blacky_Himself @Nickhod53168394 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Attendance to mass fish die-offs declined by 55%, falling from 326 in the 2019 period to 148 during the same months of 2020. https://t.co/PSLPFvzHAp

The wetland @CroxtethHall is working well. Lots more capacity to help reduce #flood risk. Imagine the impact if there were a series of ponds like this all the way along the watercourse! #NFM @EnvAgencyNW @ccnw1 @cpvolgroup @lpoolcouncil https://t.co/0h3xCFT1Ze
A very different #FloodandCoast2020 this year, but no less interesting. Well done to all who helped to bring us this morning's session on climate adaptation and mitigation https://t.co/6wSE8hkh9s

New inquiry: Water Quality in Rivers! üë©üèΩ‚Äçüî¨ What indicators of river water quality should best be used for targets under the Environment Bill? How can consumers be persuaded to change their behaviour to minimise pollution? ü§î

tweets.text: Amazing talk by @Feargal_Sharkey on the disastrous neglect by policymakers and @EnvAgency of the Cam and other rivers. Tells us to take inspiration for a civic fight back from the Northern Ireland Civil Rights Movement.

@paulcotswolds @gloss @EnvAgency Good work - @Feargal_Sharkey has been on the case for this more generally for ages. 

He might know some good people for you to be linked up with on this issue.

#Environment Scrutiny going live at 10am, with @paulcotswolds & Cllr Fisher bringing our motion to clean #Gloucestershire's #rivers.

Watch Paul, Bernie & the committee quiz the @EnvAgencySW on why our rivers are dirtier than ever & plans to restore them.

https://t.co/LFcajtrWiJ

Read the full transcript of our Thursday hearing with @DefraGovUK @hmtreasury @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency on @GOVUK readiness to meet its long term #climate & #environment goals and #targets

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW
